title: Oil Rises for a Third Week
text: Oil is rising after posting its third-straight weekly gain amid growing optimism the worst may be over. OPEC+ says it’s seeing growing signs of a recovery in demand as major producers move to quickly cut production. Bloomberg’s Su Keenan reports on “Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia.”

title: Don't bet against America, says Fed chief on '60 Minutes'
text: The US economy is going through an unprecedented recession and a recovery will take time. Even so, you don't want to bet against America's economy, said Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell on CBS' News '60 Minutes' Sunday night.

title: U.S. Dollar Will Gravitate a Bit Higher, Says Pepperstone’s Weston
text: Chris Weston, head of research at Pepperstone Group, discusses the demand for safe havens amid the exuberance in markets.

title: Oil prices climb more than $1 ahead of WTI June contract expiry
text: Oil prices jumped by more than $1 a barrel on Monday to their highest in more than a month, supported by ongoing output cuts and signs of gradual recovery in fuel demand as more countries ease curbs imposed to stop the coronavirus pandemic spreading.

title: Asia shares make cautious gains, oil and gold jump
text: Asian shares crept ahead on Monday and oil prices hit a five-week high as more countries re-opened their economies stirring hopes the world was nearer to emerging from recession.

title: Powell says jobless rate could top 30%, but he doesn't see another Depression
text: The central bank chief conceded that jobless numbers will look a lot like they did during the 1930s.

title: Why U.S. Oil And Natural Gas Demand Will Rebound From COVID-19
text: Let’s look at few trends that we know have been established in recent years and you should expect to be maintained.

title: Dow futures edge higher Sunday evening as Fed's Powell says coronavirus vaccine is key but don't 'bet against American economy'
text: U.S. stock-index futures rose slightly Sunday evening as Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said that Americans need to prepare for a tough road ahead in the aftermath of the COVID-19 pandemic but said he wouldn't bet against the domestic economy's ability to persevere through the most significant public-health crisis in more than a century.

title: Short Term Energy Outlook Shows Impact Of COVID-19 On Energy Sector
text: The most recent Short Term Energy Outlook from the Energy Information Administration contains dramatic revisions to previous energy market projections in light of the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Oil Downtrend Due To Resume
text: The oil cycles have topped.

title: Top money manager cuts exposure, warns stocks are too expensive
text: Bryn Mawr Trust's Jeffrey Mills warns the risk-reward for stocks is to the downside.

title: Can Trump Kick China Companies Off The NYSE, Nasdaq?
text: Trump wants Chinese companies to abide by the 2002 Sarbanes Oxley Act. Why don't they?

title: Spread The Fed
text: In the absence of leadership from our central government, our central bank is now stepping up to the plate. Optimization of its new lending facilities, however, will require that it decentralize their administration.

title: Fed Chair Says Economic Recovery May ‘Stretch’ Through End of 2021
text: In a clip from the show “60 Minutes,” Jerome H. Powell painted an image of a slow economic recovery.

title: Are Stock Market Bulls On Borrowed Time?
text: Last week's selling put a damper on prospects for a quick and full recovery as it cooled some of the bullish sentiment. Tom Aspray takes a look at the technical indicators to determine whether time is running out for what many say is just a bear market rally.

title: Fed's Powell says full economic recovery may require coronavirus vaccine: CBS
text: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said a U.S. economic recovery may stretch deep into next year and a full comeback may depend on a coronavirus vaccine.

title: Powell says a full economic recovery may not happen without a vaccine
text: The Fed noted that the recovery likely would depend on how Americans feel about their safety.

title: Pelosi sees negotiations on new $3 trillion coronavirus legislation: CBS
text: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said on Sunday there will be negotiations on the new $3 trillion coronavirus relief legislation passed by the Democratic-controlled House of Representatives.

title: How Techno-Nationalism Will Overshadow Any U.S.-China Trade Deal
text: Recent developments will accelerate the polarization of two fundamentally different models: China’s state-capitalist system and the West’s liberal economic values, now under increasing strain

title: Short and Sharp: Market Recovery – Looks Good, Doesn’t Feel Good
text: By Seema Shah, Chief Strategist, Principal Global Investors While the extraordinary COVID-19 economic hit has caused the U.S. unemployment rate to swing from its lowest level in half a century to a peak unseen since World War II, financial markets are dancing to their own tune.

title: S&P 500 Indicates A Bear Market.  Or Does It?
text: As with the current bear market that appears to be developing, we get this constant tug of war.

title: 3 Ways To Prepare Your Portfolio for a  Recession
text: Worried about a double-dip, but want to stay invested? If so, these are the steps you need to take.

title: A month after negative oil prices, U.S. crude contract expiry looms
text: A month after sellers had to pay nearly $40 a barrel to get rid of U.S. oil futures, the next watershed moment looms with the expiry of the June contract on Tuesday - and so far there is little sign of a repeat of the historic plunge.

title: Oil Prices Stage a Modest Recovery as Demand Rises and Supply Drops
text: The U.S. benchmark approached $30 a barrel, a month after briefly falling below zero, but it’s still far from where it was before the pandemic.

title: Weighing The Week Ahead: There Are No Shortcuts
text: The economic calendar features housing data, now from a period after the start of the crisis.
